verses.verseStringB: In the name of Allah, the Compassionate, the Merciful.
The Reality.
What is the Reality?
What will make you understand what the Reality is?
Thamood and Aad denied the Catastrophe.
As for Thamood, they were annihilated by the Overwhelming.

verses.verseString: وَأَمَّا عَادٌ فَأُهْلِكُوا بِرِيحٍ صَرْصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٍ
verses.verseStringB: And as for Aad, they were annihilated by a furious, roaring wind.

verses.verseString: سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيْهِمْ سَبْعَ لَيَالٍ وَثَمَانِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومًا فَتَرَى الْقَوْمَ فِيهَا صَرْعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ خَاوِيَةٍ
verses.verseStringB: He unleashed it against them for seven nights and eight days, in succession. You could see the people tossed around, as if they were hollow palm trunks.
Can you see any remnant of them?

verses.verseString: وَجَاءَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَنْ قَبْلَهُ وَالْمُؤْتَفِكَاتُ بِالْخَاطِئَةِ
verses.verseStringB: Then came Pharaoh, and those before him, and the Overturned Cities indulged in sin.

verses.verseString: فَعَصَوْا رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَهُمْ أَخْذَةً رَابِيَةً
verses.verseStringB: They disobeyed their Lord's messenger, so He seized them with a devastating grip.

verses.verseString: إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَى الْمَاءُ حَمَلْنَاكُمْ فِي الْجَارِيَةِ
verses.verseStringB: When the waters overflowed, We carried you in the cruising Ark.

verses.verseString: لِنَجْعَلَهَا لَكُمْ تَذْكِرَةً وَتَعِيَهَا أُذُنٌ وَاعِيَةٌ
verses.verseStringB: To make it a lesson for you—and so that retaining ears may retain it.

verses.verseString: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِي الصُّورِ نَفْخَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ
verses.verseStringB: Then, when the Trumpet is blown, a single blow.

verses.verseString: وَحُمِلَتِ الْأَرْضُ وَالْجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةً وَاحِدَةً
verses.verseStringB: And the earth and the mountains are lifted, and crushed with a single blow.
On that Day, the Inevitable will come to pass.
And the sky will crack. On that Day, it will be frail.

verses.verseString: وَالْمَلَكُ عَلَىٰ أَرْجَائِهَا ۚ وَيَحْمِلُ عَرْشَ رَبِّكَ فَوْقَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ ثَمَانِيَةٌ
verses.verseStringB: And the angels will be ranged around its borders, while on that day eight will be carrying your Lord’s throne above them.

verses.verseString: يَوْمَئِذٍ تُعْرَضُونَ لَا تَخْفَىٰ مِنْكُمْ خَافِيَةٌ
verses.verseStringB: On that Day, you will be exposed, and no secret of yours will remain hidden.

verses.verseString: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَابَهُ بِيَمِينِهِ فَيَقُولُ هَاؤُمُ اقْرَءُوا كِتَابِيَهْ
verses.verseStringB: As for him who is given his book in his right hand, he will say, “Here, take my book and read it.
I knew I would be held accountable.”
So he will be in pleasant living.
In a lofty Garden.
Its pickings are within reach.

verses.verseString: كُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا هَنِيئًا بِمَا أَسْلَفْتُمْ فِي الْأَيَّامِ الْخَالِيَةِ
verses.verseStringB: “Eat and drink merrily for what you did in days gone by.”

verses.verseString: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَابَهُ بِشِمَالِهِ فَيَقُولُ يَا لَيْتَنِي لَمْ أُوتَ كِتَابِيَهْ
verses.verseStringB: But as for him who is given his book in his left hand, he will say, “I wish I was never given my book.
And never knew what my account was.
I wish it was the end.
My money did not avail me.
My power has vanished from me.”
“Take him and shackle him.
Then scorch him in the Blaze.

verses.verseString: ثُمَّ فِي سِلْسِلَةٍ ذَرْعُهَا سَبْعُونَ ذِرَاعًا فَاسْلُكُوهُ
verses.verseStringB: Then in a chain whose length is seventy cubits, tie him up.

verses.verseString: إِنَّهُ كَانَ لَا يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ الْعَظِيمِ
verses.verseStringB: For he would not believe in Allah, the Great.
Nor would he advocate the feeding of the destitute.
So he has no friend here today.
And no food, except scum.
Which none will eat, except the sinners.”
So I swear by what you see.
And by what you do not see.
It is the speech of a noble messenger.

verses.verseString: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ شَاعِرٍ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَا تُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And it is not the speech of a poet—little do you believe.

verses.verseString: وَلَا بِقَوْلِ كَاهِنٍ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Nor is it the speech of a fortune-teller. Little do you reflect.
A revelation from the Lord of the Worlds.
Had he falsely attributed some statements to Us.
We would have seized him by the right arm.
Then slashed his lifeline.

verses.verseString: فَمَا مِنْكُمْ مِنْ أَحَدٍ عَنْهُ حَاجِزِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And none of you could have restrained Us from him.
And it is a reminder for the righteous.
And We know that some of you will deny it.
And it is a source of regret for the unbelievers.
Yet it is the truth of certainty.
So glorify the Name of your Lord, the Magnificent.
